history.content: Two techs over the summer is roughly equivalent to four techs during a regular semester, and 61C has quite a high workload. I would not recommend this unless you've done a similar workload (4 techs, 2 of which are high workload) during a regular semester - even if you have done that, I hesitate to recommend it.

children.subject: I agree with the comments here about 61C. Can't speak for 188 (haven't taken it), but I had a lot of exposure to 61C topics beforehand (basically the entire first third of the class and bits - no pun intended - and pieces of other stuff) and still found it incredibly challenging. I was only in 13 units the semester I took it, and still felt overworked at many points in the semester. Don't take it lightly.

I agree with both of the comments above. Took 61C last semester and I may have invested over 10 hours a week just to understand the material. I don't think the concepts themselves were "difficult" but personally, as I had little to no experience with computer architecture, taking in all the new information every single lecture was what made it so time intensive. Plus, I have many friends who took the course over the summer and to this day, I still hear horror stories about one of the projects.

Would not recommend, even if you’re familiar with low level programming and some computer architecture. 

The thing is, 61C is high workload. Every lecture is a new concept. It’s not like 61B where you can sit around for 2 weeks with the same idea. 61C covers a lot in a short time (more so felt during the summer I’d imagine). Plus the projects are almost all conceptual, and require some good understanding of the lecture material to get right. 

Even though 188 isn’t a high workload course, the exams in that class can be quite challenging, and also, it’s graded on a fixed scale, so no curve to save. 

Overall, not saying it can’t be done, but just don’t think it’s wise.
61c is so much work. Don't even recommend taking it alone in the summer.

history.content: Hi, I'm considering taking 61C and 188 together over the summer because it would take a huge load off for the rest of the academic year, but I'm a little nervous about the workload. From what I've heard, 61C will be tough, and 188 has notoriously difficult tests. I'd really appreciate any kind of thoughts/warnings. Thanks!
history.subject: 61C and 188 over the summer?
